intro: Laplacea vulcanica, commonly known as the volcanic lichen, is a unique species that thrives in extreme environments. It is a composite organism consisting of a fungus and a green alga or cyanobacterium, forming a symbiotic relationship. This plant is typically found in volcanic regions where it can withstand high temperatures and nutrient-poor soils. Its structure is characterized by a crust-like growth that adheres tightly to surfaces. Due to its specialized adaptations, Laplacea vulcanica plays a significant role in early succession in harsh, volcanic ecosystems.
